title: FedRDMA: Communication-Efficient Cross-Silo Federated LLM via Chunked RDMA Transmission
abstract: Communication overhead is a significant bottleneck in federated learning (FL), which has been exaggerated with the increasing size of AI models. In this paper, we propose FedRDMA, a communication-efficient cross-silo FL system that integrates RDMA into the FL communication protocol. To overcome the limitations of RDMA in wide-area networks (WANs), FedRDMA divides the updated model into chunks and designs a series of optimization techniques to improve the efficiency and robustness of RDMA-based communication. We implement FedRDMA atop the industrial federated learning framework and evaluate it on a real-world cross-silo FL scenario. The experimental results show that FedRDMA can achieve up to 3.8× speedup in communication efficiency compared to traditional TCP/IP-based FL systems.
